name: Piccola Cucina Uptown
address: 106 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

reviews.text: My husband and I just had the most spectacular time here! The staff went above and beyond to provide the most incredible experience. The atmosphere, food, wine,  service, and authentic Italian experience made for a truly perfect evening!
Place is small with rustic atmosphere.

We went with our friends for dinner again recently. Been there many times and it is always fun. We sat in the back near the kitchen this time. Ordered several appetizers and main courses to share with the table.  Then had great deserts. Erica the hostess is wonderful and always makes our visit a memorable dining experience.
Highly recommended!  Visit often.  Reservations a must.
Back again for lunch with friends.  We ordered pasta with sausage and salad with tuna. Both were very nice. Large portions.

For all the years I've lived in New York, I had never noticed this restaurant tucked in on East 60th street. By good fortune, I had lunch with my former Internist who lives around the corner. Delicious food and very affordable with lunchtime specials.

Piccola Cucina Uptown used to be one of my go-to spots, but itâ€™s really gone downhill. The food quality has dropped a lot â€” the Tiramisu  was especially bad this time. Even worse, they refused to accept my gift card, claiming it had â€œexpiredâ€ after a year â€” which is actually illegal under federal and New York State law. When I tried to explain this, the manager was rude and dismissive instead of trying to help. Really disappointing to see a place I used to love treat loyal customers this way.

Una experiencia excelente en La Piccola Uptown NY. Desde que llegamos, el servicio fue impecable: todos los mesoneros muy atentos y con una actitud encantadora. En especial, Mario en la barra de abajo fue sumamente amable y servicial. La comida deliciosa, comenzamos con unos calamares a la plancha perfectamente cocidos y llenos de sabor, y un trÃ­o de carpaccios muy bien presentados. De plato fuerte, probamos el pasticho, muy sabroso, y los capitelli, que estaban realmente exquisitos. Un lugar cÃ¡lido, con gran ambiente y atenciÃ³n de primera. Sin duda, Â¡muy recomendado y con ganas de volver!

VERY DISAPPOINTED with my experience today. I had a restaurant gift card with remaining balance, but they REFUSED to accept it just because it was â€œover a year old.â€ I checked both federal and New York laws â€” there is NO rule that allows a gift card to expire after one year. This is NOT OK.

The manager showed me an email that someone else supposedly received and said it was my problem. I explained several times that no one ever told me about any expiration when I bought or used it before â€” I was even told it would NOT EXPIRE. She just kept saying â€œthatâ€™s not possible.â€

I ended up paying out of pocket. Later at home, I checked their website â€” and it says NOTHING about any expiration date. This is completely MISLEADING and feels like FRAUD. UNACCEPTABLE customer service and dishonest policy.
Heerlijke pastaâ€™s gegeten. Geen halal vlees maar er zijn ook prima vis en vega opties. Cacio e pepe was super lekker

This location stands out for its authentic vibe and flavorful dishes. The calamari was amazing, and the octopus carpaccio had a perfect balance with the veggies. The truffle branzino is an absolute must try unforgettable flavor!Unfortunately, the cacio e pepe was disappointing beautiful presentation but too watery and lacking in cheesy flavor. The signature clam spaghetti was nice for seafood lovers.The biggest letdown was the service. My cocktail arrived 20 minutes late (and only after I asked again), and it tasted mostly like water and ice. The wine came out almost after we finished the appetizers, and the server didnâ€™t pour it, just left it on ice bucket. She sent out all the appetizers at the same time, even though we were there to enjoy a relaxed, pleasant dinner(the  table was small, and unfortunately, it was impossible to find space for more than two appetizers.)
Desserts were fantastic. I wish the server had treated us more like guests rather than just customers. We wouldnâ€™t have felt like they wanted us to leave quickly, and we would have had a much nicer overall experience.
Very good Italian food
Excelente atenciÃ³n, ambiente y calidad de la comida. Pedimos pastas y tiramisÃº de postre. Todo genial

Excellent experience. Went with my wife and 2 kids. They were accommodating to the kids and our food was absolutely delicious. Wine was great too. Ambience was perfect and the location was convenient. Highly recommend.
Great ambiance and staff! Highly recommend

First visit wonâ€™t be my last! I sat at the bar, and Edwin took impeccable care of me. Everything from the bread service (soft, rustic slices with sun-dried tomato EVOO, carrot confit, and pureed chick peas), lobster ravioli (special), beer (Forst), wine (Brunello, as expertly suggested by Edwin), and cannoli, exceeded expectations. A perfect lunch experience for my lazy Sunday.  All kudos to Edwin and the kitchen!
Dined here multiple times. As an Italian, I appreciate the authenticity they bring (literally) to the table. From the staff to the food, incredible setting and food.
ìˆ˜ì œ í‹°ë¼ë¯¸ìˆ˜ê°€ ë§›ìˆëŠ”ì§‘

I have been here twice, and both times found it interesting how in the whoooooole restaurant, somehow only Asian guests were seated in the veeeeerrryyyyy back near the kitchen (worst seats). What are the chances that both times I go, all 3-4 tables in that back area are occupied by Asian diners, while all other tables in the beautiful main area are given to white diners? Shocked that this happens in a city like NYC

UPDATE: Piccola Cucina is still AMAZING. ğŸ

This is an Italian restaurant GEM located in Midtown East. Conveniently located a block away from the 4,5,6,N,R AND W trains, Piccola Cucina offers authentic Italian cuisine and more!

Let's start with the vibe. The restaurant's rustic vibe adds a warm and comforting ambience and let's not forget the staff! The folks at Piccola Cucina were so friendly and accommodating, especially since I came here for a work lunch consisting of over 10 people!

Oh, right, the FOOD!!! I don't know where to start but I included images to this review. After all, a picture is worth a thousand words. Right?

I personally had the ossobuco ravioli, and I couldn't have enough!

Pro-tip: Check out the beautiful bar too! I definitely want to return and sit there for some wine and appetizers.

The atmosphere inside the restaurant is cozy. The food is delicious, and the staff are friendly, so Iâ€™m very satisfied.

ê°€ê²Œ ë‚´ë¶€ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ê°€ ì•„ëŠ‘í•¨. ìŒì‹ë„ ë§›ìˆê³  ì§ì›ë“¤ë„ ì¹œì ˆí•´ì„œ ë§¤ìš° ë§Œì¡±í•¨.

We booked this for my mums 60th birthday. The food was great particularly the tiramisu. However, there is a lack of detail when it comes to service. There was no mention of the fact that it was my mums birthday which was disappointing considering this had been mentioned on the booking. The staff also werenâ€™t ready for our booking and seem frustrated that we had inconvenienced them. We did arrive early however we were waiting for over 10 minutes. Overall a good restaurant but a lack of attention to detail when it comes to service.
Burrata and ribeye very tasty ğŸ«¶ğŸ˜‹
Lobster pasta is a WOW! Squid ink pasta a bit too salty. Tiramisu is always a fun experience here - they will make it in front of you!

Update 2025: Celebrated our little munchkins birthday here, because our little one said, he had a great time here with his mom and dad! Was a no brainer given the perfect service we experienced on our previous visit. We got lucky with their upstair seating this time around, and were seated in a cozy 4-person seating.

Ordered some crudities (delicious), fried fish which has a good amount of shellfish, and their amazing mushroom pasta which you can't go wrong with. When we said we are going to share the pasta - the super thoughtful staff ensured we got two portions served, something that we really appreciated! Order the Tiramisu for dessert and watch it being prepared in front of you for a unique experience!

Service was spectacular, including playing a kiddie happy birthday song for our little one which made him feel absolutely special. Can't ask for anything more! Will be one of our favorite places to go to, thanks to the excellent service, great experience, and excellent food!

Previous review: Had made reservations for dinner night with my family, and was greeted by a very friendly hostess who got us seated on our table. The ambiance and setup is very romantic and perfect for a date night of a family meal.

We got straight to ordering and got a bottle of Valpolicella ($129) which was absolutely delicious. Other things in our order included a tasty Caprese Salad ($21.95), and absolutely deliciously prepared Bucatini cacio e pepe ($26.95), Pappardelle ai funghi porcini ($25.95), and Cavatelli con ragÃ¹ di agnello, carciofi ed erbette ($26.95).

I am no Italian to certify amazing Italian food, but of all the Pasta's I've tasted in my life, this was the best pasta I've ever had. Flavor packed, perfectly cooked, and delicious food! Service was excellent, and food arrives within 7 minutes of ordering. Friendly staff too. Noise levels were slightly on the above average end. Will definitely recommend to friends and family and will definitely visit again!
The appetizer selection menu is delightful, itâ€™s variety of flavors and texture makes it a most have.

Picccola offers a delightful dining experience with its charming ambiance and attentive service. The menu features a variety of authentic Italian dishes that are both flavorful and beautifully presented. Highlights include their fresh pasta and delectable seafood options. The warm and inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for a cozy dinner or a special occasion!
Too much noise because of the train we were sitting outside.
The best pasta Iâ€™ve had in a long time! The squid ink pasta is full of umami. Super satisfying dinner!  Lovely staff too.
Uma excelente Pizza, aliche Ã© show.
Seriously delicious food, best Iâ€™ve had in the states. Highly recommend.

We came there for my 15th birthday, some of the nicest waiters Iâ€™ve ever met. My 50 year old Italian father gave me a tip about one of their pastas which was amazing, for desserts we have the cannolis which were amazing and Iâ€™m not a big cannoli fan. The tiramisu was the best tiramisu Iâ€™ve ever had and my father confirmed. We told them about the birthday and they were so amazing about it and did a show and showed how they make the tiramisu in real time. My little brother had the ciaco e Pepe which was amazing and so authentic. As a 15 year old Iâ€™m not a pricing expert but my father says itâ€™s not cheap but not expensive either. In conclusion itâ€™s an amazing restaurant, and has an amazing garden view. An overall authentic, amazing experience, filled with great atmosphere, and most importantly amazing food.

Food is amazing. I like the sun dried tomatoes so much. We did most wine refills ourself. The service is good if they are around, can be hard to catch their attention tho. Would definitely stop by again for the food.
Really nice, tried lots of places and recommend this one in the area for sure
Had the Ravioli in veal sauce and it was delicious! Great service, very attentive but not overbearing. Fresh bread to start and very punctual with timing after finishing food. Will be coming back!
Great place,  excellent service, delicious food. Highly recommended!

Piccola Cucina is one of my favorite spots in NYC, and the Italian hostess is my favorite person in the city. Iâ€™m obsessed with their tartufo nero focaccia. Itâ€™s technically no longer on the menu, but they still make it for me every time I go, and it never disappoints. That kind of hospitality (and flavor!) is rare. Also, donâ€™t sleep on the complimentary bread basketâ€”the fresh bread and house-made sauces that come with it would already be reason enough to have me keep coming back.

Perfect environment and food!
Todo delicioso!!! Toda la pasta es exquisita !!TiramisÃº excelente !!

Deliciosa experiÃªncia! Atendimento muito bom. FÃ¡cil comunicaÃ§Ã£o e agilidade dos garÃ§ons.
Comemos os pratos cacio e pepe e o tagliatelle verde com ragu e tartufo nero. Maravilhosos!

Cute place for a date night or special occasion. I got the lasagna and really liked it but everyone else in our party was disappointed with their food. Especially the lobster pasta dish that had the smallest amount of lobster possible. The cacio e pepe was very one note but i think thats just an issue with cacio pepe in general and not just this restaurant. The lasagna was filling and delicious
I can't get enough of this place. Always great

Focaccia and pomodoro in olive oil sauce. From monday to friday 11:30 am to 2 pm lunch serial for razonable price $19.95 (offers star marked in menu) Italian delicious Cheff Gourmet and classic italian meals. Ravioles. Lassagna de la mama rosa. Lamb e pasta en salsa.
Verdure alla grillia.
Parmilliana de Mellanzagne
Attendance to make from 11:30 am to 11 pm  your evening pleasent. Italian. Spanish. English.
Waiters. Hostess. It is like a Little Italy at Manhattan Upp town. Exquisite wines. I love it.
The service was amazing and the food probably the best pasta I have ever eaten! Would definitely recommend!
Great pasta and tiramisu. Real Italian taste and high quality of produce in the heart of Manhattan. Highly recommend.
Best Italian restaurant in NYC
Excellent food and drinks. Very clean and great service. The food was fresh and delicious. Pastas are made from scratch and are a must when coming hereâ€” I will definitely be back!

Yum! Feels like very authentic Italian food. Waiter was so nice and provided excellent recommendations. I returned here after a year just to eat their squid ink pasta and tiramisu again. It was so delicious. Portions are very generous as well.
Great food and very pleasant place

Hands down the best Italian restaurant in the city. The food here is incredibly authenticâ€”easily comparable to what I had during my trip to Rome. Every time I visit, Iâ€™m genuinely impressed.

I started with the octopus Caprese, which was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. But the real star is the pasta. Itâ€™s simply outstandingâ€”chewy, perfectly cooked, and full of rich, comforting flavor. Honestly, itâ€™s the kind of pasta that makes you stop mid-bite just to appreciate how good it is.

Whenever I eat here, I leave feeling genuinely happy and grateful that a place like this exists in the city. Highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates authentic Italian cuisine.

Really good Italian cuisine. This is as authentic as I've gotten. Recommend making a reservation. The times that I've been here I've gotten in by chance. A little bit of chaos since there's a lot of people on a semi small area. The cacio e pepe is made in front of you with fresh pepper added on top. The lasagna is a big portion with plenty of ground meat, sauce and cheese. I love the dishes they use to serve the food on. The the 3 sides that are served with the bread are delicious even though I don't know what they are.

This place is the real deal. The Italian hostess greets you warmly, setting the tone for an experience that feels authentically Italian.

The food is outstanding. I ordered the green tagliatelle with wild boar ragu and it was phenomenal. Honestly as good, if not better, than pasta Iâ€™ve had in Italy. The Caesar salad was also excellent, very fresh tasting and delicious. They start you off with bread and dips at the beginning of the meal, which is a thoughtful touch. Iâ€™m not a cannoli guy but I actually liked these. Theyâ€™re great.

Service here is some of the best Iâ€™ve experienced in New York, incredibly friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. Really nice ambience inside too. If youâ€™re looking for a true Italian restaurant that delivers on both food and atmosphere, this is the place. Iâ€™d absolutely come back.

Absolutely loved this Italian restaurant! The food is top quality â€“ fresh, authentic, and full of flavor. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. They also offer a great lunch menu for just 19.90, which is a fantastic deal. Highly recommend!

It's lunchtime on Saturday afternoon, the last day of May.
All the staff were pleasant and friendly.
The restaurant interior and atmosphere were so nice~
Of course, the best thing is the food.
It tastes the best.
Especially the tiramisu for dessert is the best I've ever had.
The coffee is also delicious.
The bartender's cocktail show is also something to see.
You will never regret it.

QUALITY!!!

Tiramisu is delicious and made table-side. Cool to watch.
Calamari and branzino were highlights of the items we ordered. Lasagna was also some of the best Iâ€™ve had in a long time.

Everything was of higher quality. Service, food, and vibe all alike.

We were seated promptly without a reservation. Outside seating was also a plus.
Service was good. Server wasnâ€™t present all the time because he was super busy, but he was very pleasant when he attended to our table and his runners did the job just fine.

Food was delicious. We enjoyed every bite. It was well presented and flavorful.

Interior looked beautiful and packed. We also loved seating outside and enjoying the nicer weather.

Thank you!
Weâ€™ll be back!!

Nothing but great things to say about this restaurant. From the moment you step in, you are welcomed and feel right at home. We celebrated our anniversary here and the staff went above and beyond congratulating us and giving us cannolis with a candle to celebrate.

The Cacio e Pepe and tiramisu gets served in the most beautiful authentic way that transported us back to Italy! Highly recommend! The food is to die for but the staff and wholesomeness of this place is what really sets them apart from others.

It is our absolute favourite and whenever we are in town we make sure to visit Piccola cucina!

Sincerely, your friends from Frosinone!
Foods are high quality, taste real Italian. Servers are all nice and sweet. The bummer here is their price which is quite expensive, but definitely worth a try.

This place is a mix of classy, European style on the street level and chill, low lights upstairs.

The menu is healthy and creative. It boasts flavors from the Mediterranean to Asia and could possibly be categorized as an Italian-Asian fusion.

The citrus marinated yellowtail with beets and mandarin carpaccio was incredible. The stuffed zucchini flowers were delicious.

My poke bowl with seared tuna and quinoa was amazing. Other dishes we tried were the poke bowl with salmon and Mediterranean salad.

Beautiful restaurant and perfect setting for lunch, happy hour, or dinner.

We had an amazing experience tonight at this restaurant.
Even though at the begging (having a reservation), we had to wait for a little while and it was a bit chaotic, the general experience was more than amazing. It showed that this is definitely a popular place.
When we sat, they were extremely apologetic and made sure that we were happy with the seating and even gave us a glass of Prosecco and a delicious cannoli at the end (on the house).
The food menu is very interesting, a lot of delicious choices. We shared a vitello tonnato that was amazing, very flavorful and spectacularly presented. We shared some pastas and they were al dente and very flavorful too. I would definitely come back to try many other dishes.
The wine list is well curated with reasonable prices.
The service was great too. We learned some Italian words and the proper way to eat a cannoli. It was a very enjoyable experience.

A high end 2 level italian restaurant on midtown. The balcony seems a lovely place to spend an afternoon. The dishes were excellent though a bit expensive. Tableside tiramisu was interesting performance. Service was attentive good spot for a date night.

Piccola Cucina Uptown is a lively and popular Italian spot in NYC. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was buzzingâ€”dim lighting, shelves filled with wine and Italian goods, and a packed house that gave the place an energetic, almost festive vibe. Our waitress was just okay, but the busboys were attentive and helpful throughout the night.

Our family shared several dishes. We started with the Piccola Cucina Saladâ€”a vibrant mix of baby spinach, beets, oranges, avocado, toasted nuts, and dried fruit. It was super fresh and well-balanced, the perfect light and colorful way to begin the meal. But the pasta dishes were the real highlight. The Tagliatelle with ragÃ¹ and truffle was rich, earthy, and deeply flavorful, with perfectly al dente pasta. The Rigatoni with lamb ragÃ¹ was bold and indulgentâ€”the richness of the lamb stood out, but the mint added a refreshing brightness that balanced it beautifully.

We also got to watch the cheese wheel pasta experience at a nearby table, where hot cacio e pepe was tossed in a giant wheel of Pecorino right in front of everyone. It was such a fun, theatrical moment and added to the overall experience.

For dessert, we shared the pistachio gelato and raspberry sorbet. The gelato was massiveâ€”super creamy, intensely pistachio-forward, and surprisingly salty in the best possible way. The sorbet was tart and refreshing, served with fresh berries, and made for a light, clean finish to a rich meal.

Overall, the food was thoughtfully prepared and full of flavor, and the atmosphere made the night feel special. Iâ€™d definitely come back and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy, energetic spot for truly satisfying Italian food in the city.

The food was tasty, but nothing really stood out. Thatâ€™s okay for any restaurant, but not at this price. The place is way overrated. You can easily find the same quality and taste for half the price. So itâ€™s up to you. The service was good, and the staff were very friendly.

Absolutely fantastic experience.  I can't wait to visit more of his restaurants.

Piccola Cucina Uptown is such a gem â€” easily one of the best Italian spots Iâ€™ve been to in NYC! The food is absolutely incredible â€” super fresh, full of flavor, and you can tell everything is made with so much care.

The vibe of the place is cozy and welcoming, like youâ€™re eating at a friendâ€™s house (who just happens to be an amazing chef). The pasta dishes are unreal, the seafood is fresh and perfectly cooked, and honestly, you really canâ€™t go wrong with anything on the menu.

The staff is awesome too â€” super friendly and they make you feel right at home. Itâ€™s the kind of place where you sit down and instantly know youâ€™re in for a great night.

If youâ€™re looking for a warm, authentic Italian meal in the city, Piccola Cucina Uptown is an absolute must. Already planning my next visit!

We had such a lovely time at Piccola Cucina! The experience was incredible & made even better by our amazing server, Jessica, who was so attentive and helpful.

We ordered the passion fruit cocktail, the calamari, and the pistachio pesto and salmon pasta â€” every single dish was unreal.

Beyond the food, the service is what really elevates the experience here. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

Che dire tutto favolo dal antipasto al vino e al servizio. 10/10. Bello stare lontano di casa e trovare delle persona che ti fanno sentire vicino con una cosa cosÃ¬ semplice come il cibo. Bravi ragazzi, veramente â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ğŸ¥‚ torneremo e vi aspettiamo in Sicilia

This restaurant truly lived up to expectations! The complimentary bread was a nice touch, served with three flavorful sauces/toppings on the side.

Must-try dishes:
- The octopus caprese with burrata, tomato confit, and basil was fantastic! The octopus was perfectly charred, paired beautifully with the creamy burrata, and drizzled with olive oil.

- The trio of raw fish--salmon, tuna, and scallop--was incredibly fresh, seasoned simply with salt, pepper, and capers for a clean bite.

- The green tagliatelle in wild boar ragÃ¹ with truffles was good, though I would have loved a bit more truffle flavor.

- The paccheri with scampi, langoustine, lobster, and shrimp was a highlight. The pasta was cooked al dente, and there was a generous amount of seafood.

The pastas are shareable and come in large portions. I'd highly recommend this spot and look forward to returning to try more of the pasta dishes!

I had a great experience here in Piccola. About the food, it is good or not depending on your personal favors and sometimes cultural but overall was great. The service was excellent. They took care really well for every customer and they put the heart in to the food and services. Beatrice was beyond impressed. Every staff contributed to the perfect dinning experience in this place. Can't say enough but encourage you to come and try like I did.

Great location, easy to get to
The ambiance is wonderful!
The staff are super nice and service is quick
The place was busy so reservations are advised

Now to the food-in one word :delicious
In more than one word,we ordered:
Salmon tartar - it has a very nice lemon pop to it
Burrata - fresh and creamy, goes wonderfully with the fresh bread
Lamb ragu pasta ( I don't remember the actual name of the dish so my apologies to the chef here)- the pasta was perfectly cooked and the lamb ragu was flavourful and tasty

We washed it all down with some delicious cocktails and finished the meal with an apple honey cake that was nice and fluffy

All and all highly recommend:)

Locale molto carino, camerieri gentili ed educati ma soprattutto cibo italiano!!
Piatti buonissimi e di qualitÃ , una cosa che apprezzo molto Ã¨ che ci siano opzioni senza glutine tra cui la pasta, rara da trovare a new york.
La proprietaria Ã¨ italiana e i prezzi sono onesti per la qualitÃ  del cibo e della pasta italiana.
Consigliatissimo

Food 10/10. Bread & spread blew me out of the water. Pasta dishes were authentic and flavorful.
Service 10/10. I rarely tip more than 20% but I did this time. Incredibly friendly yet professional staff. Even provided backgrounds on each dish.
